ezff.interfaces.gulp - Interface to GULP¶

Interface to GULP, the General Utility Lattice Program

class ezff.interfaces.gulp.job(verbose=False, path='.')[source]¶

Class representing a GULP calculation

cleanup()[source]¶

Clean-up after the completion of a GULP job. Deletes input, output and forcefields files

read_atomic_structure(structure_file)[source]¶

Read-in atomic structure. Currently only VASP POSCAR/CONTCAR files are supported

Parameters:structure_file (str) – Filename of the atomic structure file
Returns:xtal trajectory with the structure in the first snapshot
run(command=None, parallel=False, processors=1, timeout=None)[source]¶

Execute GULP job with user-defined parameters

Parameters:
  • command (str) – path to GULP executable
  • parallel (bool) – Flag for parallel execution
  • processors (int) – Number of processors for parallel execution of each GULP job
  • timeout (int) – GULP job is automatically killed after timeout seconds
write_script_file(convert_reaxff=None)[source]¶

Write-out a complete GULP script file, job.scriptfile, based on job parameters

Parameters:convert_reaxff (bool) – Optional function that manipulates job.forcefield before the script file is written
ezff.interfaces.gulp.read_elastic_moduli(outfilename)[source]¶

Read elastic modulus matrix from a completed GULP job

Parameters:outfilename (str) – Path of the stdout from the GULP job
Returns:6x6 Elastic modulus matrix in GPa
ezff.interfaces.gulp.read_energy(outfilename)[source]¶

Read single-point from a completed GULP job

Parameters:outfilename (str) – Path of the stdout from the GULP job
Returns:Energy of the structure in eV
ezff.interfaces.gulp.read_lattice_constant(outfilename)[source]¶

Read lattice constant values from a completed GULP job

Parameters:outfilename (str) – Path of the stdout from the GULP job
Returns:Dictionary with abc - 3 lattice constants, ang - 3 supercell angles, err_abc - error in lattice constant, err_ang - error in supercell angles
ezff.interfaces.gulp.read_phonon_dispersion(phonon_dispersion_file, units='cm-1')[source]¶

Read phonon dispersion from a complete GULP job

Parameters:phonon_dispersion_file (str) – Path of file containing phonon dispersion from the GULP job
Returns:2D np.array containing the phonon dispersion in THz
